Recap: Dinah and Mallet argue about taste in food, movies and music. They make up as fast as the fights start. Dinah gets Harley to go with her to a crazed half- price sale of wedding gowns. In the hustle and bustle of the venue, a woman grabs Dinah's dream dress. Dinah finds out that she is allergic to all types of live flowers and cannot make a decision on the floral arrangements. She gets into a fight with the baker because Ross Marlar had at one time sent the baker's mother to prison. Dinah smashes pastries in his face. At the police station, Blake arrives and tells her that she got the charges dropped. Dinah runs into the woman who grabbed her wedding dress and is able to get the dress back. As Dinah looks at herself in the mirror and envisioning her wedding, Mallet finds an online blog, the "Springfield Burns". The headlines read: "Which Spaulding Executive isn't just shopping for a wedding gown  but for her boss' husband? What else are they hiding?" He then finds pictures of Dinah and Gus on a bed, kissing.
Transcript: Dinah: Men! What would they do without us? What would I do without you? I still can't believe you're going to be my husband. Gosh, husband! That's a weird word if you say it over and over. Husband, husband, husband, husband. Has-been, has-been, has-been. Has-been? Wait, how can he be a has-been? We're not even married yet. Oh, it feels like a jigsaw puzzle, but it's real. You and me, baby. Detective A.C. Mallet, we are perfect together.

Mallet: Oh, that was awesome! That was fantastic.

Dinah: Yeah, I saw it, and it was stupid.

(Laughs) It's a lot of fun, especially when you know somebody's got your back.

Dinah: Uh-huh. If you don't get there early enough, you're out of luck. But I am feeling very lucky these days. Now, I'd love to sit, I'd love to chat, but I can't, okay? I have a whole day of wedding planning ahead of me.
Mallet: Well, I would love to be a part of it, but, you know, I got that pesky cop job-thing, and I have a hang-nail on my left pinky that's really acting up, so I...
Dinah: Honey, it's okay. You're off the hook. I am on it, okay? I am going to make sure we don't arrive at our engagement party without anything actually figured out.

Bob: Yeah, right. What my mother did was nothing compared to you. You're a murderer, but your dad didn't lift a finger to bring you to justice. What a hypocrite!

Dinah: You know something, Bob? You know what I like? I like devil foods cake. I do. I think it's wonderful. Have you ever had it? Why don't you taste? I hear it's the best in the city! Huh? Have you ever tried chocolate?
Blake: Dinah!
Dinah: Huh?

Mallet: Then you smashed the cupcake upside the baker's head.

Blake: What do you want first, the good news or the bad news?

It causes trouble for me, and I get tense, and people don't like me when I'm like that. And quite honestly, I'm the happiest I've ever been right now.

Dinah: Blah, blah, blah.

Dinah: Okay.

Mallet: You know when you're luck starts to change, don't you? You get rid of that chip, that chip on your shoulder. You don't have to prove that to yourself by throwing away that perfectly good cell phone. Everything is going to be fine.

Dinah: Hey, Olivia.

Dinah: Once upon a time, there was a carnival orphan who grew up to be a convicted felon and town pariah, and her enemies were all around her. (Applause) But with a little self-control and the love of the best guy in the land, she eventually blossomed into a respected member of society.
